The purpose of the outer perimeter is to create a parking lot to be used by vehicles that come to the isolated area (providing food and medical supplies), which cannot return to the city unless they are disinfected and remain in quarantine in the outer perimeter. Instead of quarantining people, the outer perimeter would quarantine used vehicles and/or equipment. As currently demonstrated in South Korea, this proposal is feasible, less disruptive and, potentially, more effective than delayed and generic (non-georeferenced) policies ( Lessons from SK, 2020).
